page.title: 12EPPING UPLAND CHURCH
page.content: ALL SAINTS CHURCH is the parish church of Epping Upland,mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086. In the graveyard the war memorial has the names of twelve people from the parish who died in the war of 1914-18 Most died in Egypt,France or Gallipoli The church tower has a bell chamber with 6 bells,all with different inscriptions.The clock bell,given by John Conyers in 1793,cost 102 pounds and 17 pence. Inside the church,the pulpit and font are 14th Cent. and there is a carved wooden screen and altar details. Most of the stained glass windows in the Nave are recent:most have pictures of saints,often with the same name as the people who gave them. The South Porch has a Lych Gate.
